Docs.param: A formatter context. This object can be used to get more information about the environment this converter is being called from. This may be , so you should always check. Also, properties on the context object may also return .
A object that specifies formatting conventions used by a particular culture.
Docs.summary: Converts an (or an object that can be cast to an ) to the specified type.
Docs.returns: This method returns the converted object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The most common type conversion is to and from a string type. The default implementation calls the <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> method of the object if the object is valid and if the destination type is string. If this method cannot convert the specified object to the destination type, it throws a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception.

Docs.summary: Gets the set of properties for this type.
Docs.returns: The set of properties that should be exposed for this data type. If no properties should be exposed, this can return . The default implementation always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, a type does not return any properties. An easy implementation of this method calls the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetProperties%2A> method for the correct data type.
